defs: = ತೊನೆಪ.
a man having smooth, white patches on various parts of the body caused by leucoderma.
a woman having smooth, white patches on various parts of the body caused by leucoderma.
a skin disorder characterised by smooth, white patches on various parts of the body, caused by the loss of the natural pigment; leucoderma; vitiligo.
= ತೊನ್ನುಹಿಡಿ.
= ತೊನ್ನ.
= ತೊನ್ನುಹಿಡಿ.
(leucoderma) to affect a person with white patches on the body.
an onomatopoeically formed word imitating the heavy sound made by an object when fell down loosely.
an onomatopoeically formed word imitating the sound as made by continuous fall of rain drops.
(falling) continuously with or as with the sounds of rain drops.
the natural outer covering of fruits or vegetables; the skin.
the outside covering of the stems and roots of trees and woody plants; the bark.
= ತೊಪ್ಪಟೆ.
(falling) suddenly and with a heavy sound (as made by an object that fell loosely).
the plant Boerhaavia diffusa (= B. procumbens, = B. repens) of Nyctaginaceae family; the spreading hog weed.
= ತೊಪ್ಪಲು.
(collectively) leaves (esp. young ones) of plants.
the tree Acacia leucophloea of Mimosae family.
another acacia tree Acacia farnesiana of the same family.
the twining shrub Aristolochia indica of Aristolochiaceae family; Indian birth wort; serpent root plant.
= ತೊಪ್ಪಲು.
any close-fitting head covering, either brimless or with a projecting brim, and made of wool, cotton, etc.; a cap.
the condition or fact of being very fat, without strength; fatness, stoutness; obesity; corpulence.
ತೊಪ್ಪೆ ಮೈ toppe mai the body (of a person) that is very fat but not having corresponding strength.
the excrement of cattle, buffalo, that is not dried.
ತೊಪ್ಪೆ ತಟ್ಟು toppe taṭṭu to make flat cake from the undried dung of cattle or buffalo; ತೊಪ್ಪೆ ಹಾಕು toppe hāku (said of cattle, buffalo) to discharge the dung.
to work as a slave.
nine times.
a connected group; a cluster; a bunch.
a collection or assemblage of large number of persons at a place.
a line in which number of persons or things are arranged; a row.
the fact or state of excelling; superiority; eminence; excellence.
to become more in quantity, number, degree, etc.
= ತೊಯ್ಯಿಸು.
a dish made of pulses with or without vegetables.
the condition of being soaked (thoroughly) (as in water).
to make thoroughly wet; to drench or saturate; to soak.
to become soaked in a liquid (as water, blood, etc.).
to cause to be soaked so.
the medium-sized, evergreen tree Pongamia pinnata (= P. glabra) of Papilionaceae family, known for its cool shadow and hard wood.
a kind of fish.
a kind of fish-catching net.
that which has become a soft, semisolid mass; a coagulated thing.
= ತೊರತ್ತಿ.
the natural source of a stream; a oozing of usu. water from underground; something that oozes.
the large, evergreen tree Hydnocarpus alpina of Flacourtiaceae family.
another tree of the same family, H. Laurifolia (= H. wightiana).

a kind of.
the act of giving up or sacrificing (something); abandonment; sacrifice.
exemption from the controls, restraints or confinements, 3. that which is fit to be or must be, abandoned.

a large, vascular, lymphatic organ in the upper left part of the abdominal cavity of vertebrates, near the stomach, that has various functions in modifying the structure of the blood and forms part of the immune system; the spleen.
a kind of insect.
the plant Wendlandia glabrata of Rubiaceae family.
to abandon - a) to leave completely and finally; to forsake utterly; to desert; b) to give up; to discontinue; to withdraw from; c) to give up the control of.

to flow (as a river).
to extend over a greater or a considerable area; to spread oneself.

to happen; to occur.

either of the banks of a river.

its fruit.

a section of the trunk or of a large branch of a felled tree, either in its natural state or cut up for use in building, as firewood, etc.; a log.
a long, heavy log of wood used in ancient wars to bang and open the entrance gates of a fort.
a seat suspended from above by means of a loop of rope or between ropes or rods, on which one may sit and swing to and fro for recreation; a swing.
an ancient unit of weight, equal to the weight of a rupee coin.
an instrument for weighing, esp. one that opposes equal weights, as in two matched shallow pans hanging from either end of a lever supported exactly in the middle; a balance.
similarity in some respects between two or more different things; resemblance.
a southern constellation between Virgo and Scorpio; the Scales.
the seventh sign of the zodiac, entered by the sun about September 23; Libra.

the natural outer covering of fruits or vegetables; the skin.
